list_definition.definition: a hot drink made from espresso coffee with hot frothy milk, often served with whipped cream or powdered cinnamon or chocolate on top

list_ex_of_english: Besides traditional circus fare like popcorn (sold from an old-fashioned circus wagon) upscale items such as cappuccino and veggie wraps were offered.
More frothed milk makes it weaker than a cappuccino.
A cappuccino is traditionally served in a porcelain cup, which has far better heat retention characteristics than glass or paper.
Flavoring oils such as mint, orange, and cappuccino were developed to give the chocolate extra taste.
Passenger amenities include washrooms, a cappuccino bar, power outlets, wheelchair accessibility, and space for bicycles.
Competitors prepare and serve three courses of espresso based beverages consisting of espressos, traditional cappuccinos, and signature drinks.
Cappuccino, being compiled directly in the web browser, is agnostic of the server-side logic.
It is more difficult to prepare than cappuccino due to half-and-half being more difficult to foam.
